item.title: Small Beginnings
item.short_blurb: Give your baby animal the best with our Baby Health and Wellness Package, which includes vaccines, a wellness check, and grooming.

item.title: Prime-of-life
item.short_blurb: Make sure your adult stays healthy our Adult Health and Wellness Package which includes a wellness exam, vaccine boosters, a heartworm check, and more.

item.title: Healthy & Active in Old Age
item.short_blurb: Make sure your senior has the best quality of life with our Senior Care Package. We'll help you keep your pet healthy with a comprehensive exam, blood work, x-rays and more to ensure your pets health well into old age.

item.body_text_2: From pre-appointment to post-appointment we take care of you every step of the way. We ensure that your pet is well cared for and that you can be comfortable with the decisions that you're making because you're well-informed of all your options. We'll treat your companion with compassionate care.

item.body_text:
Zesty Pet Clinic

1045 Sixth Avenue

San Diego, CA 92101


Our Hours:

  • Sunday 10am - 3pm
  • Monday 9am - 7pm
  • Tuesday 9am - 6pm
  • Wednesday 9am - 7pm
  • Thursday 9am - 6pm
  • Friday 9am - 7pm
  • Saturday 9am - 6pm

For general information, questions, appointment requests, call us at:

Tel: 555-555-5555


For after-hour emergencies, call our on-call doctor at:

Tel: 1-800-555-5555

Zesty Pet Clinic

At Zesty Pet Clinic we are here to support you. Please see our list of resources below. If you think of something else that we may be able to help you with, please contact us.

Please select from our options below:

  • FAQ
  • Breeder Questions
  • Links

Zesty Pet Clinic

Please see a list of frequently asked questions below.

Need more information? Please contact us

Questions to Ask Your Potential Breeder

When selecting a breeder it can be difficult to know what questions to ask. We've provided a list of common questions to ask your potential breeder.

These have been adapted from the American Kennel Club's blog

.

Helpful Links

Here is a list of links to some of our favorite resources contact us

!

Please select from a category below or scroll down to browse the list:

item.question: Do you have a veterinarian on-call for after-hours emergencies?
item.answer: Yes, we do. If you have an after-hours emergency, please call us at: 1-800-555-5555.

item.question: What types of flea medication do you offer?
item.answer: We offer injectable, oral, and topical flea solutions. Please ask your veterinarian about which one would work best for your needs.

item.question: How often should I brush my dog or cat's teeth?
item.answer: It's important to start the habit when they are young and get them used to the feel of the toothbrush. Ideally, a daily brushing for dogs, and every other day for cats. Ask your veterinarian for tips on how to train your pet tp get used to this routine.

item.question: How long have you been breeding? What's your experience with this breed?
item.answer: It's important to know what how much experience your breeder has with breeding and their specific breed. They should be able to address their breed's strengths and weaknesses, as well as any diseases or genetic predisposition that might affect them. You may also want to ask your breeder if they're involved in any kind of clubs or organizations related to their breed.

item.question: How do you socialize your puppies?
item.answer: Socialized puppies will have experiences with other animals, children, and adults. This will help your dog to be a better adjusted adult, and much less likely for him/her to be fearful or anxious in situations inside and outside of the household. For example, a children's party at your house, or a day out at the beach; a well socialized dog will likely be much more comfortable in these surroundings if they're well socialized as puppies.

item.question: How can we contact you after picking up the puppy?
item.answer: Make sure that you have the contact information from the breeder. They are an invaluable source of information and will be able to answer many questions for you. The breeder should be willing to give you their contact information and encourage you to contact them should you have any questions or concerns. Be wary of a breeder that will not give out their contact information.

item.body_text:
General Health


We offer general checkups 2 times a year. Keep your pet the healthiest that they can be with out biannual comprehensive exams. During your pet's checkup, you can opt for grooming services, which include bathing, haircut, nail trim, and more!

Pet vaccines fall into two categories: core and non-core. Core vaccines are vaccines that are recommended for every pet. Non-core vaccines are vaccines that may be recommened based on your pet's lifestyle. For example, if your pet is boarded a lot, or spends a lot of time outdoors, you may want to consider additional vaccines for your pet.

Our pets, just like humans, will have changing medical and health needs as they age. Our care packages will help you get the most comprehensive care for your pet from baby to senior. Each package covers comprehensive exams, possible vaccines or medication, nutritional consulation, heartworm test and more.


Baby


Our Baby Package includes:

  • Comprehensive physical exam
  • Recommended vaccines


Adult


Our Adult Package includes:

  • Comprehensive exam and complete history
  • Blood work (CBC and 8 tests)
  • Fecal test to check for common parasites

Senior


Our Senior Package includes:

  • Comprehensive exam and history
  • Blood work (CBC and 30 tests)
  • Fecal test to check for common parasites
  • 5 x-rays of chest and abdomen

Dental care is an integral part of your pets health. Poor dental health can lead to other health problems, including heart problems. To help your pet be the best health possible, we offer professional cleanings, and training and tips to help your pet get used to daily tooth brushing.

About Us

At Zesty Pet Clinic we're here to support the health and wellness of your pet. We offer a wide variety of services including:

  • Boarding
  • Day Care
  • Medical Services
  • Dental Services
  • General Care and Care Packages

We're located conveniently close to public transportation in sunny downtown San Diego near the historical Gaslamp Quarter.

Meet the Team

Our team is here to help you. Our goal is to meet your needs as it pertains to the health and well-being of their pet. Our clients' pets are members of their family, and expect the same quality healthcare as they would for any other member of their family.
When your pet comes to Zesty Pet Clinic they become a part of our family too.
Testimonials
Careers
Please checkout our videos below.
Meet our pets, clients, and patients!

item.employee_bio: Dr. Bob has been practicing veterianary medicine for over 30 years. He brings his expertise in dogs, cats, farm animals, and exotics and a degree from Muppet Veterinary University to our humble office.
Nurse Piggy comes to us with over 25 years of experience working in many types of animals. Her comforting bedside manner will be sure to put your pets at ease.
Nurse Janice comes to use with 5 years of experience. For many years she was a travelling musician, until she decided to turn towards her love of animals.
Receptionist Sam feels it's his duty to help others and to run a very organized office. He loves to keep our office running and our clients and their pets happy.

item.client_testimonial: I started coming to Zesty Pet Clinic in 2000 when I was having an issue with my flipper. They were able to work around my hectic schedule to get me in and treat my sprain. I was able to heal up quickly and get back to work. They have the best service and a kind, compassionate, and knowledgeable team.

Last year when I hit a fork in the road, I didn't know what to do. My Studebaker was ruined and I was injured. I made an emergency call Zesty Pet Clinic and their on-call doctor treated me right away. After I went home they followed up with me to make sure I was well on my way to healing. This year I've been able to return to my natural habitat - a Studebaker.

I was so grateful to find a vet that specializes in all kinds of exotics! They're my go-to office and I recommend them to everyone I know. Their team has been so kind and generous. Dr. Bob has an excellent bedside manner and the Nurses Janice and Piggy are always helpful. Camilla and I will never go to another veterinarian.

item.job_description: Busy practice looking to add a FT veterinary receptionist and or RVT,CVA to our staff. Experience in veterinary field is first criteria. Duties include answering multiple phone lines, organizational skills, strong in communication and team support as well as assisting clients and Doctor as needed. We are looking for professional as well as curtious and willing to meet the employers demand as a team member with our current staff. We look forward to hearing from you.

Growing AAHA-accredited small animal and exotics hospital is seeking an experienced full-time practice manager to add to our team.  Duties include, but are not limited to, personnel and employee benefit management, marketing, accounting, financial planning, client relations and general practice development. The successful candidate must have a strong work ethic, excellent interpersonal skills and be able to handle the stress and emotions that come with working in a fast paced veterinary hospital. We look forward to hearing from you.

Highly motivated registered or experienced technician wanted to join our large modern hospital. The applicant must have advanced technical and nursing skills and possess a lively, outgoing spirit. We want a team member who will become an integral part of a client/patient/doctor relationship. Experience in puppy/kitten socialization and obedience training would be a plus. We look forward to hearing from you.

item.video_title: How To Wash a Kitten Without Making it Scared
item.video_description: It's important to get your cat used to baths, why not start getting them used to it as a kitten! This video will show you techniques on how to bathe a kitten without scaring it.

item.video_title: How To Groom a Maine Coon
item.video_description: Developing good grooming habits are important, especially with long-haired cats like Maine Coons. Here we'll demonstrate how to groom your cat including bathing, blow drying, nail trimming, and haircuts.
Learn some basic grooming techniques for your dog.

item.photo_description: KitKat is one of our clients. She's been coming to see for 6 months now and is growing into a healthy adult.
Mister Cheddar is their newest member of the family.
Nurse Janice loves to help out her furry friends.
